get.summary: Run a search against the locations search index.
get.description: All results are ordered by distance from the location given in the `query` parameter, going from nearest to furthest.

parameters.name: by
parameters.description: Options are `free-query`, `postcode` and `coords`. See the `query` parameter for details on each option.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
If `by=free-query`, this expects an address string such as `query=32 Oldham Street, Manchester`. Using commas to split address lines is encouraged.

If `by=postcode`, this expects any valid UK postcode.

If `by=coords`, this expects a latitude/longitude string. For example, `query=53.482813,-2.235183`.

parameters.name: boundingShapeId
parameters.description:
Cannot be included if `boundingShape` or `distance` have also been sent with the request.

It's possible to store geo-shapes in the service for easy reference when searching locations. Provide the ID of the shape with a location search query to constrain your search to within the shape's coordinates.

parameters.name: boundingShape
parameters.description:
Cannot be included if `boundingShapeId` or `distance` have also been sent with the request.

Constrain the search to the given bounding shape. Expects a string generated with the [Polyline algorithm](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm) that represents a geo-shape. The geo-shape must be a polygon with at least 4 sides, and its first and last points must be identical (so a 4-sided shape will have 5 points).

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description:
Cannot be included if `boundingShape` or `boundingShapeId` have also been sent with the request.

Constrain the search to the given distance in miles. This will be the default constraint if no constraints have been provided with the request, the value of which is set in the service's configuration.

data.description: An array of location objects, in order of nearest to furthest to the query location. An empty array if the search returns no results.

get.summary: Run a search against the articles search index.
get.description: Searches use OR logic. This means that the query "inquisitive rabbit" will return any results that contain _either_ "inquisitive" OR "rabbit".

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A term or phrase to query the search index with.

parameters.name: in
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to search in. Defaults to "name,articleBody,abstract". All fields, except for the "sensitive" field, from the `ArticleObject` schema can be listed in this parameter.

data.description: An array of article objects, or an empty array if the search returns no results.

example.author: Alex Tani
example.name: [The title of the article]
example.abstract: [An excerpt from or short summary of the content]

page.description: The page of results to send in the response.

addressLocality.name: addressLocality
addressLocality.description: Typically a county, e.g. Greater Manchester.

schema.description: A URL to a featured image for the article.

shapePolyline.name: polyline
shapePolyline.description:
Cannot be included if `coordinates` has also been sent with the request, otherwise it is required.

Encode the actual coordinates using the [Polyline algorithm](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/utilities/polylinealgorithm) and send the encoded string as this parameter's value.

shapeCoordinates.name: coordinates
shapeCoordinates.description:
Cannot be included if `polyline` has also been sent with the request, otherwise it is required.

Expects an array of arrays. Each inner array must have both the "lat" and "lon" keys.

NOTE: URLs have length limits so it's recommended that the request is instead sent with JSON body if this parameter will be a part of it.
